title: Disconnect from ganache-cli forked mainnet
body:
##  Issue

I run project tests in ganache-cli fork of mainnet over infura. And when tests took too long I receive this:
```
Could not connect to your Ethereum client with the following parameters:
    - host       > localhost
    - port       > 9545
    - network_id > 1
Please check that your Ethereum client:
    - is running
    - is accepting RPC connections (i.e., "--rpc" option is used in geth)
    - is accessible over the network
    - is properly configured in your Truffle configuration file (truffle-config.js)
```

But I am pretty sure `ganache-cli` is still running. What's happening?

## Environment

* Operating System: 
* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.1.4
* node version (`node --version`): 10.17.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.11.3
Any thoughts?
Hi @k06a, thanks for bringing this up! Can you share some steps to reproduce this issue, so we can dig in?
Could you log the JSON RPC (`truffle test --verbose-rpc`) and show us that? Might provide some insight.
@gnidan will check!
Truffle verbose: [log.txt](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/files/4098781/log.txt)
Hi @k06a thank you for providing your logs, it does look like ganache is not responding as expected. Can you provide a link to your project so we can try to reproduce this? Thanks!

Hi, everyone!

I'm facing the same issue when running tests and coverage locally. However, the issue does not appear when running tests using GitHub Actions.

Unfortunately, I work in a private repo, but I can provide any logs if needed.

Adding this to our backlog to dig into.
